utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE

utterances.speaker: LAH

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We, the people, of Shasta County are gathered here today in a peaceful assembly to appeal to our Shasta County Board of Supervisors. It is the right of the people to alter or abolish it and establish new government.

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: They took a pandemic, and they weaponized it against us, business owners. And we got to the point where, look, enough is enough.Right now we're being peaceful, and you better be happy that we're good citizens, that we're peaceful citizens. But it's not going to be peaceful much longer.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Zapata, a militia member, warned that a revolt was coming.(On-camera): And it started here because of, would you say that viral speech you gave at the board meeting?

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: Yes, I've been told that that was the spark that lit the fire. You know.I've been in combat and I never want to go back again. But I'm telling you what, I will to save this country. If it has to be against our own citizens, it will happen. And there's a million people like me, and you won't stop us. When I say these things about violence and, you know, civil uprising, it's not a threat, you know. This is a warning.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: What do you mean by it could have been violent?

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: The calls I was getting were, hey, I have guns. Where are we meeting, you know? I was like the voice of reason, you know. I'm glad you have guns. Stock up your ammo, but we're not there yet. So anybody that calls us violent or insurrectionists or, you know, outlaws, we're not.LAH (voice-over): But he did use threatening language.

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: We also have people on the streets. We know where you live. We know who your family is. We know your dog's name. You don't vote your way out of socialism. Once it takes root, the only way to eradicate it is to fight with arms, to have a violent, violent confrontation, to have blood in the streets.LAH (on-camera): Anger is OK, but this type of public anger.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Who showed me her ranch.

utterances.speaker: RICKERT
utterances.sentences: Come on, girls. Let's go. I love this county. We're just doing the very best we can, given the circumstances with the pandemic and everything.LAH (on-camera): You're a lifelong Republican, right?

utterances.speaker: RICKERT
utterances.sentences: I've been a Republican for most of my adult life, yes. Yes. And I've had several threats that were fairly severe. I had one, the subject line was, going, going, gone. Dead woman walking.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: You've had nightmares?

utterances.speaker: RICKERT
utterances.sentences: I have nightmares.LAH (voice-over): That fear was shared by another recall target, Leonard Moty. (On-camera): You're a lifelong Republican. LEONARD MOTY, FORMER DISTRICT 2 SUPERVISOR, SHASTA COUNTY, CALIFORNIA: Oh, yes, proud. Well, used to be proud. I'm not so sure anymore. But, yes, lifelong Republican. I spent 31 years at the Redding Police Department and six years as the chief.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Were you more concerned as a board member for your safety versus being the chief of police?

utterances.speaker: MOTY
utterances.sentences: As a board member, absolutely.You have a number of important choices to make on election day. LAH (voice-over): During repeated death threats online.

utterances.speaker: MOTY
utterances.sentences: "I'm pretty sure he's not expecting a lynch mob, but I bet he's going to get one."LAH (on-camera): And that's directed to you?

utterances.speaker: MOTY
utterances.sentences: Yes. "Time to dust off the old guillotine. He needs a dirt nap. A dirt nap. Bury you in the ground, dead. That's a dirt nap.LAH (voice-over): Some came in public, at supervisors' meetings.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Flee now while you can. Ropes are reusable.

utterances.speaker: MOTY
utterances.sentences: We never went out and cited people. We didn't shut down businesses. We didn't -- we just asked people to do the best you can.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I'll just go over a few housekeeping rules.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Mary Rickert and one other board member survived the recall attempt, but Leonard Moty lost. ZAPATAfocus on what is done, but rather on the work ahead. Lack of decorum will not get us where we want to be. All eyes are on us now, and we can't afford to be uncivil.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Gracious in victory. But months later, Zapata says the end justifies the means, especially the hostile language.(On-camera): It was very course. It was violent.

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: Was it? Was it really?

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Yes. I think it was.

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: To who?

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: To the board?

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: Did it work?

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: To the enemy at large?

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: Did it work? Did we succeed? We did. A healthy fear is good. Government should fear the people.LAH (voice-over): Zapata says the threats have gone both ways. He has been a target.

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: I get death threats from people. I've had people say they would love to see my house burned down with my kids in it.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: But remains undeterred.

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: As I sort of become a leader in this movement, I've realized that people want nothing more than to get on board to get their freedom back.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Zapata and his compatriots have chronicled their fight and their success in this, their document series "Red, White, and Blueprint."

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: We are free to do what we want. And I don't need permission. I don't need permission to what (INAUDIBLE).So "Red, White, and Blueprint" really came as an idea of making a blueprint for other counties to follow. LAH (on-camera): How many other counties have reached out to you?

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: A lot.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: It's a beautiful day to fly.HARDY BULLOCK, 5TH DISTRICT SUPERVISOR, NEVADA COUNTY, CALIFORNIA: Yes, it's a great day to fly. LAH (voice-over): Not far from the recalls of Shasta County, we're getting a bird's-eye view of Nevada County, California, with Hardy Bullock.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: I'm the Fifth District supervisor for Nevada County. This is home. I was born here, and now I live with my family in eastern Nevada County. I think that's one of the pieces that everybody shares, all of humanity is down there, good, bad, and otherwise. It makes me really appreciate the people that live here.LAH (on-camera): Even the ones who give you headaches?

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: Yes, even the ones that give me headaches.I started January 4th of 2021. I had constructed this reality that I thought it would be like for me when I got up there, and it was very different.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: All right. Please raise your right hand and repeat after me.LAH (voice-over): That difference was immediately apparent.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: Oh, I heard the word recall, I think, in my first meeting. I haven't voted on anything so they're recalling somebody that just got there.LAH (on-camera): Like literally just got there.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: It was in the height of COVID.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You guys have locked down the schools and everything around us. You're putting people out of work.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: There was a lot of fear, a lot of tension.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: If you can't handle this job, step down. Step down.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: Yelling.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You're willfully choosing to ignore the data.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: Screaming.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Do you job or get out of our way. Otherwise, we will take you out of our way.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: We had security protocols in advance of our meetings. We couldn't go into the chambers because we had threats against our life.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You think this charade and your little fake wall is going to do anything for us people? Yes, I'm over your shit.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: It must have been wild.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: Yes, it was pretty wild.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I am going to come after each one of you personally.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You'll be lucky if you get out of this alive.HEIDI HALL, DISTRICT 1 SUPERVISOR, NEVADA COUNTY, CALIFORNIA: So I'm Heidi Hall. I've been on the board of supervisors for six years. I've always been in public service. LAH (on-camera): Tell me about the recall effort.

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: Yes. So all five of us have been told we're going to be recalled. You know, what's funny is it's against all of us, so two Democrats, three Republicans. They don't like anything that we're doing.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Did Shasta influence Nevada County?

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: There was some commonality. There were some of the same people showing up.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Let's go over some of the accusations made against you and the other supervisors. You're part of a global world order conspiracy. Practicing medicine without a license. Enabled crimes against humanity. Censored public comments.

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: Right. It's ridiculous. It's performative politics. It's finding things to complain about without participating in a process to make things better for people.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: The reasons for the recall?

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: What is -- you've seen this.

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: Yes, I have. Yes. In my position, I don't have any authority to conduct most of what's described here. UNIDENTIFIED FEMALEbut are (EXPLETIVE DELETED) up our cities, and I'm sick of it.

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: There was just extreme anger and frustration. They attacked us personally. There was just sort of a lack of humanity. We've continued to work well as a board, but everything changed in terms of how the public interacted with us.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You will face judgment.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: There's no organization, the WHO, the CDC, you all that can separate me from my God-given rights as a United States citizen.

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: They wanted their own facts. It's just this rage of wanting their own way.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Where does that come from?

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: You know, I don't want to keep harping on Trump, but there is this Trumpism that when Trump came into power, he made it acceptable to say science isn't true. He made it acceptable to mock people. He made it acceptable to say, "It's us, the white men in power, who are being attacked and harassed." And people who are already challenged or fearful or angry or concerned about their own status in life picked up on that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Let's all get up and move.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Are you scared?

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: We had to leave meetings with sheriffs by us. We had different levels of security that we had to employ. We lock our doors. We have an awareness of who's out there. You know, my kids have been approached by people and asked if their dad was a supervisor, and they don't know who these people are.

utterances.speaker: CALVIN CLARK, NEVADA COUNTY RESIDENT
utterances.sentences: Yes, I would like to address the board of supervisors.LAH (voice-over): Calvin Clark, an outspoken long-time resident of Nevada County led the recall effort.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: There's a real disconnect throughout the United States in regard to citizens and the elected board of supervisors and their county staff. There was really no standardization in this pandemic. It was over the top. It was beyond clear protection of the citizens' rights.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: In December of 2021, Clark made an appearance on the New America, the John Birch Society's online magazine, where he discussed the Nevada County recall efforts.

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: Doing recalls and calling them into the accountable place of their oath of office. If they don't understand it, this is a way to avoid a civil war. They should think about it. LAH (on-camera)that?

utterances.speaker: CLARK
utterances.sentences: You know, we have where too much government gets to be tyranny. And yet we start adopting small strings of tyranny until we start to be bound down and our rights get lost, and then pretty soon we don't know who's really at the end of a third-party contract to track your children.BRIAN LEVIN, DIRECTOR, CENTER FOR THE STUDY OF HATE AND EXTREMISM AT CALIFORNIA STATE UNIVERSITY-SAN BERNARDINO: COVID is what galvanized not only different depths and tiers with respect to fears and the related aggression, but it got all these tributaries together into one raging stream. LAH (voice-over): Brian Levin is the director of the Center for the Study of Hate and Extremism at California State University-San Bernardino.

utterances.speaker: LEVIN
utterances.sentences: They are seeing local governance become the traitors that are depriving them of the rights that they previously said was being done at the hands of the federal government.

utterances.speaker: LEVIN
utterances.sentences: He lost. 17 percent of the vote was all he got. They are entering politics not necessarily to win but to make themselves brazenly, loudly, and aggressively known with the now not-so-indirect threat of violence.

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: My concern is for the country, for this community. It's a very disturbing trend we're seeing throughout the country, but I don't believe that we're going to really get past it without addressing the anger that does not come from a rational place.

utterances.speaker: LEVIN
utterances.sentences: These people are angry that they feel fear that there is a multi-tiered takeover not only of the government but what it means to be an American in their local communities.LAH (on-camera): What's happening to local elected officials across the country when there is all of this anger being directed at people like you?

utterances.speaker: BULLOCK
utterances.sentences: People are getting out of elected and appointed office because it's too hard on them and their families. Good people are deciding not to run for office.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You don't run this show no more.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: People got executed for violating the Nuremberg Code, and you guys are violating the Nuremberg Code, too.

utterances.speaker: HALL
utterances.sentences: I want to emphasize that that is a minority in this county, but this minority of people, I think, are destructive to this community and to the country.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You will get the justice that's coming to you.LAH (voice-over): Next.

utterances.speaker: MICHON
utterances.sentences: Raise the frigging bar.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: School board members fear for their lives.

utterances.speaker: BRENDAN SHERIDAN, LOUDOUN COUNTY SCHOOL BOARD MEMBER
utterances.sentences: This is the letter that was sent to my son. It arrived with Christmas cards in December, and I just thought it was another card from somebody I didn't know."It is too bad that your mama is an ugly communist whore. If she doesn't quit or resign before the end of the year, we will kill her, but first we will kill you." LAH (voice-over): Brenda Sheridan is a school board member in Loudoun County, Virginia.

utterances.speaker: SHERIDAN
utterances.sentences: It's not the job we expected in 2019 when we were running. It's the job we got. It wasn't the job I had the previous eight years.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: What a stupid, dumb, ignorant (EXPLETIVE DELETED) you are, you liberal hag.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Hi. I just wanted to call you up and let you know what a sick (EXPLETIVE DELETED) you are for preying on the minds of children. Maybe you should take your fat ass to the gym. You know your home address is on the internet, don't you? That could be a little scary.

utterances.speaker: SHERIDAN
utterances.sentences: I seldom go anywhere by myself because of the threats, and I don't think there is any bigger fear than putting your own children and your own family in harm's way.(CROWD SHOUTING SHAME ON YOU)

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: During the pandemic, school boards in several states were becoming battlegrounds.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Figure it out or get off the podium.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Over school closings, transgender rights, and diversity education.

utterances.speaker: LEVIN
utterances.sentences: COVID and the fact that people were at home and were online more and were angrier more, at a time of polarization were able to transform what in the past were rather sleepy gatherings into battles to plant that flag.LAH (on-camera): Was there a moment when things changed?

utterances.speaker: SHERIDAN
utterances.sentences: I like to say that there was a smoldering fire from the pandemic, and the angry parents, but as it started to have a lull.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: You don't wipe out racism with more racism.

utterances.speaker: SHERIDAN
utterances.sentences: Someone would ignite the fire again with a little gasoline.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: What was that gasoline?

utterances.speaker: SHERIDAN
utterances.sentences: The first thing was CRT. And that we were teaching CRT in our schools.LAH (voice-over): Critical race theory, which is rarely taught outside of law schools, asserts that racism is inherent in U.S. laws and society, which has angered some who say it promotes an anti-white agenda.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You're divisive, racist, and hate-filled policies are being spewed into the minds of my children.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Our kids are being brainwashed to hate their country, its founding, themselves, and each other by being taught the Marxist communist principles of critical race theory.LAH (on-camera): Do the Loudoun County public schools teach CRT?

utterances.speaker: ZIEGLER
utterances.sentences: No. No. I don't know of any school division in the country that's teaching CRT.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Then why are people angry about it?

utterances.speaker: ZIEGLER
utterances.sentences: Because it's become that catch all. Right. CRT means everything that I don't like about schools.LAH (voice-over): Dr. Scott Ziegler is a superintendent of schools for Loudoun County, a suburb of D.C. it is one of the wealthiest counties in the country and has become increasingly diverse.

utterances.speaker: ZIEGLER
utterances.sentences: If you go back 25 years, the county, the student body was over 80 percent Caucasian. Today, our Caucasian students are about 45 percent, 46 percent of our student body. I became interim superintendent officially on January 6th, 2021.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: 2021, so really in the thick of it.

utterances.speaker: ZIEGLER
utterances.sentences: Yes. Yes.LAH (voice-over): Like Sheridan and other school board members, Ziegler became a lightning rod for hate when vitriol escalated over issues like a state law that expanded the rights of transgender students, including the right to use school bathrooms of the gender they identify with.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Two alleged sexual assaults at two different high schools.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: And two sexual assault incidents involving a male student, who was sentenced by a judge to a residential treatment center.

utterances.speaker: ZIEGLER
utterances.sentences: I expected some controversy, and of course every superintendent goes through that. I didn't expect the hatred. I didn't expect the threats.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: How does that impact you walking to your car or going to the grocery store?

utterances.speaker: ZIEGLER
utterances.sentences: It makes a big impact. I am a concealed weapons permit holder, but certainly now I'm more conscious of when I'm carrying and when I'm not carrying.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: These are clowns. Vote them out.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Do you look back at some of the rage in these meetings and some of the threats that have been levied against these school board members, whether you agree with them or don't agree with them? Do you look and hold some responsibility for that?

utterances.speaker: IAN PRIOR, EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, FIGHT FOR SCHOOLS
utterances.sentences: No. I can only speak my mind. I take responsibility for what I say and for what I do. We condemn threats, whether it's to the school board or the community.LAH (voice-over): Ian Prior is a lawyer and a parent with two kids in the district. He's also a former Trump administration official. (On-camera): So you really spent a good decade, a decade and a half, in the Republican ecosystem.

utterances.speaker: PRIOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: As an operative.

utterances.speaker: PRIOR
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: And been sort of switched to suburban life. PRIORLAH (voice-over): Merging career with parenthood, he wrote this for "The Federalist," a conservative publication. "The school board and the administration are willfully using children as guinea pigs in their unconstitutional experiments in race-based communism." The article got his name put on what he calls an enemies list, posted on a private Facebook group that some school board members were a part of.

utterances.speaker: PRIOR
utterances.sentences: And it just struck me as, this is cancel culture coming to your neighborhood. And I ended up going on Tucker Carlson talking about it.They're called the anti-racist parents of Loudoun County. We call them chardonnay Antifa. LAH (on-camera): When did you first hear about Shasta County?

utterances.speaker: PRIOR
utterances.sentences: I think there was like a documentary out on it.LAH (voice-over): Shasta County is where Carlos Zapata helped lead the successful recall of a Republican board member.

utterances.speaker: ZAPATA
utterances.sentences: People all over the country are getting fed up.

utterances.speaker: LAH
utterances.sentences: Showing how he and others did it in a documentary series called "Red, White and Blueprint."

utterances.speaker: PRIOR
utterances.sentences: It just came to my mind that, hey, this happened in Shasta. Let me look up Virginia recall statute. In Virginia, you don't have that. You have a removal.
